report.label: None yet
report.description: As per the Settings documentation: Note: If you're developing your application for Android 3.0 and higher, you should instead use PreferenceFragment. Go to the next section about Using Preference Fragments. Nearly all of the methods in PreferenceActivity are deprecated, and using a PreferenceFragment is the clear recommendation. This would also eliminate the need for Build.VERSION_CODES.HONEYCOMB checks and related annotations.

Would it be possible to hide the alliances tab if say, there isn't any data on that team for elims? Or display a text like "This team did not advance to eliminations"? For a team that did advance to elims, displaying all 8 alliances with the current format might make it hard for users to find their team. I was thinking either bolding the team, or just displaying the alliance that team is on.

report.label: None yet
report.description: My lack of experience with Android is really slowing down the development process on this. Let me outline how I believe the refreshing scheme should work. A refresh will consist of three steps: render, update, and render. Refreshes are triggered when starting an Activity or when the user manually refreshes. To support this, each Fragment needs to implement render() an update(). render() makes the appropriate SQL queries locally to fetch all the models needed to render a page, and then populates the Fragment with that info. It must be able to handle cases where not all data is in the local DB and display as much as possible. If feasible, each unique query should hold a lock with the result temporarily cached within the scope of the Activity, so multiple concurrent Fragments making the same queries can reuse the result. update() makes the fewest number of API calls needed to populate the local DB with everything the Fragment needs to render. Upon receiving an API response, we need to drop all table rows associated with that response (this should always be possible due to the way API endpoints are setup). For example, after receiving a response from /api/v2/team/frc254/event/2014casj/awards, award table rows satisfying the query eventKey = 2014casj AND winners LIKE %254% must be dropped (this isn't the most efficient, but will do for now) and new rows constructed from the response must be inserted. Also, the cached value of the SQL query made in render() must also be dropped. One key implementation detail of the update() method is that locks must be held for each unique API endpoint. This way, concurrent updates from multiple fragments that hit the same API endpoint don't make multiple requests to the same endpoint at once, and after one returns, we can rely on the API rate limit to prevent hitting the endpoint again. We should start by implementing everything without any of the caching and locks (but keeping them in mind) and adding them after.

report.summary: help the user access the webcast
report.label: None yet
report.description: Doing a web search on the phone for madtown throwdown webcast, the second result is for The Blue Alliance. Tapping that offers to open Chrome or TBA app. So pick the app. (It's great that Google provides a TBA search result but unfortunately the link is just to TBA home page, not the event page.) Picking TBA app shows the 2014 Events screen, "Week 1" tab. The URL didn't have the info to get directly to the relevant event, but the app could use today's date to pick the most relevant tab ("Offseason events"). After navigating to the event screen, I don't see how to get the webcast. There is a YouTube link that searches for videos mastching 2014mttd, none of them relevant. The desktop version of TBA home page links to the the Gameday page embedding the YouTube webcast. So if I Back up to step (1) and pick Chrome [1], the TBA mobile home page also has a Gameday page link. Tapping that again asks if I want to open it in Chrome or TBA app. Picking TBA app opens the right info screen for this Event, but no webcast. Picking Chrome gets a similar mobile page, also with webcast aid. It'll issue a different YouTube query #frcmttd OR "MadTown ThrowDown", which also doesn't work. [1] TBA app crashed at that point. Android sent a crash report. This is from a Nexus 5 running KitKat.

report.label: None yet
report.description: This bug hasn't actually occurred, but I spotted the potential for it while looking for the source. I'll outline the potential scenario: A new event is added to the FIRST database. This get's pulled in by TBA. A user opens the event list on his/her device; the new event loads. That user favorites a event on one devices. The server sends a GCM message to another device that downloads the new list of favorites. The user opens myTBA on the second device without downloading the new event list. It attempts to load the list of favorites, but the new event is not in the local database. The app crashes. The user is sad. I guess the best way to fix this is simply to hide any entities that don't exist locally when loading the favorites list. That's probably an easy fix. However, I'm too tired to fix this now, so I'm just making note of it here.

report.summary: [App v3] Move Network Requests to Retrofit
report.label: None yet
report.description: Add Retrofit library and define an API interface with a single endpoint (use hose tba.com/api/v2) with the endpoint as a single paramter. This way, we can use Retrofit's capability to return an Observable with the network result. We need to migrate our network stack to work with Observables and have something consume them. We will need to refactor RefreshableHost a bit. I'm thinking it consumes all incoming network Observables for the Activity. The child Fragments can report which endpoints they require (some public static final variable, maybe) and be notified when each endpoint comes in, and when all requests are loaded. The RefreshableHost will hold all the content, which the children can query and process. This allows us to eliminate all the Populate* tasks

report.label: None yet
report.description: In conjunction with #427, the network requests should return a (collection of) models which we can bind to views. We'll need to update the view to use the new framework, but it should allow us lots more flexibility https://developer.android.com/tools/data-binding/guide.html#viewstubs

Part 2 of this (probably should be a separate issue) is that we really need a proper header in the nav drawer for users that aren't signed into myTBA. Perhaps something blue with the TBA logo? We need an art team...

report.label: None yet
report.description: I originally posted this in the general TBA repo, it really belongs here. There seems to be several different versions of the "No internet"/"No connection"/"Couldn't load data"/"Data could be out of date" messages that are displayed when there's no network connection. As far as I can tell, they all mean exactly the same thing and should be triggered in the same situations. We should pick a single message and switch to using that everywhere where it is required.

report.summary: Invert ordering of team years participated
report.label: None yet
report.description: In appv3-datafeed, the "Select Year" dialog in the teams activity shows years in ascending order. Recent years are probably more relevant to most people, so I think the list should go in reverse chronological order.

report.label: None yet
report.description: On the app, under 2016 events, the Palmetto Regional is listed under Week 1 rather than Week 0.5, offsetting the rest of the weeks by 1.

report.summary: Redownload data causes errors with event list rendering
report.label: None yet
report.description: While trying to fix #471, I ran into a rather weird issue. It seems as though that process throws the app into some sort of invalid state that causes the rendering of the main event lists to fail. Failure occurs across all years and is isolated to the top-level event lists; event lists within team views and event views themselves still function normally. Here is the offending stacktrace: E/tba-android: UNABLE TO RENDER W/System.err: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'java.lang.Object java.lang.ref.WeakReference.get()' on a null object reference W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.adapters.BindableFragmentPagerAdapter.setAutoBindOnceAtPosition(BindableFragmentPagerAdapter.java:38) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.fragments.EventsByWeekFragment.updateLabels(EventsByWeekFragment.java:130) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.binders.EventTabBinder.updateData(EventTabBinder.java:23) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.binders.EventTabBinder.updateData(EventTabBinder.java:10) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber.lambda$bindData$33(BaseAPISubscriber.java:132) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber.access$lambda$2(BaseAPISubscriber.java) W/System.err: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.subscribers.BaseAPISubscriber$$Lambda$3.call(Unknown Source) W/System.err: at rx.internal.schedulers.ScheduledAction.run(ScheduledAction.java:55) W/System.err: at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:739) W/System.err: at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:95) W/System.err: at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:148) W/System.err: at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5417) W/System.err: at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method) W/System.err: at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:726) W/System.err: at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:616) I tested the redownload process when I was first implementing it, so either I suck at testing, this is some weird edge case, or there's been a regression somewhere.

report.summary: Don't hardcode max number of team pages
report.label: None yet
report.description: https://github.com/the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance-android/blob/master/android/src/main/java/com/thebluealliance/androidclient/adapters/TeamListFragmentPagerAdapter.java#L14 This is actually relevant now that we've run over the current max team number of 5999. Handling this properly will be interesting, because the number of teams we have in the database could change if we load in additional teams while the team lists are showing. Observable magic to the rescue? Or fire something on the EventBus when new teams are loaded and then check if we have to recompute the tabs? Open to ideas on the best way to handle this.

report.label: None yet
report.description: From a (1 star) Play Store review: Getting error code (-505) Google's troubleshooting steps all failed. Uninstalled the app to reinstall and now I still can't install it and I don't have the old version either. Unrooted SGS 4 This doesn't appear to be an issue on our side, it's most likely an issue with 5.0 itself: http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/88214/how-do-i-deal-with-unknown-installation-error-code-505 We're going to try to get the reviewer to communicate with us via this issue so we can try to do further troubleshooting.

report.label: None yet
report.description: App side component to the-blue-alliance/the-blue-alliance#1362 Backend Tasks Update Cloud Endpoints to have a media suggestion url1. This will require some server side changes Integrate Imgur API into app2 Make a background thread thing (probably IntentService?) to take image on device, upload to imgur3, and suggest to TBA. Use persistent notification for status updates. Be sure to handle lots of cases: TCP Timeout, imgur error, rate limit hit Frontend Tasks Make a button to take a picture on Team or Team@Event page (do we want to be able to choose+upload existing picture?) Prompt user for image title and description. Provide sane defaults. Fire off above task 1 Cloud Endpoints Suggestion Needs to have: User (done via oauth). Will need to have account signed in/myTBA enabled Team Key Year Suggestion "kind" (media in this case) Imgur url Metadata (in this case, we want to pass deletehash up to the server so we can modify the image in the future, even though it was upload anonymously. And maybe some other stuff?) 2Imgur API Things Docs: https://api.imgur.com/ Other Considerations: Need to register app and get tokens Note rate limiting (1,250 uploads per day or approximately 12,500 requests per day), remaining quota in X-RateLimit-UserLimit response header. Image Upload Endpoint. Returns basic response. Here is what the response looks like: { "data": { "id": "rdwAFcH", "title": null, "description": null, "datetime": 1455648595, "type": "image\/jpeg", "animated": false, "width": 1200, "height": 675, "size": 784683, "views": 0, "bandwidth": 0, "vote": null, "favorite": false, "nsfw": null, "section": null, "account_url": null, "account_id": 0, "comment_preview": null, "deletehash": "BV0r1n6UoQayKlm", "name": "", "link": "http:\/\/i.imgur.com\/rdwAFcH.jpg" }, "success": true, "status": 200 } 3File Uploads With Retrofit https://github.com/square/retrofit/wiki/%5B1063%5D-How-to-upload-file---Retrofit---2.0

report.label: None yet
report.description: So we can catch changes that break the proguard config at PR time. Probably involves creating a new buildType and setting testProguardFile http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26482119/android-unit-tests-with-proguard-enabled

report.label: None yet
report.description: We're still targeting API 22 this season for stability reasons (cans of worms and whatnot), but after champs, we'll bump it. 6.0 changes: http://developer.android.com/about/versions/marshmallow/android-6.0-changes.html Doze. We currently don't set priorities on our GCM message, but I think it's okay to leave them at normal. Runtime Permissions. We currently request GET_ACCOUNTS and WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE, which are considered Dangerous Permissions, so we'll have to implement requesting them at runtime. GET_ACCOUNTS is used at install time, I believe, to set up the device account when you sign into myTBA. WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is used to store suggested images taken before they're uploaded. I don't think any of the other changes should affect us. This library seems awesome for making runtime permissions easier

report.label: None yet
report.description:
While running a debug build, run the script scripts/test_notification.py awards-posted It sends a GCM to the client over adb. The client displays a notification but also logs a stack trace because a SQL constraint rejects an attempt to add the row to the DB without a key. E/SQLiteLog: (1299) abort at 8 in [INSERT INTO awards(name,enum,winners,year) VALUES (?,?,?,?)]: NOT NULL constraint failed: awards.key E/SQLiteDatabase: Error inserting name=Regional Chairman's Award enum=0 winners=[{"awardee":null,"team_number":2067},{"awardee":null,"team_number":78},{"awardee":null,"team_number":811},{"awardee":null,"team_number":2648}] year=2014 android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConstraintException: NOT NULL constraint failed: awards.key (code 1299) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.nativeExecuteForLastInsertedRowId(Native Method) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteConnection.executeForLastInsertedRowId(SQLiteConnection.java:782) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteSession.executeForLastInsertedRowId(SQLiteSession.java:788) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteStatement.executeInsert(SQLiteStatement.java:86) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.insertWithOnConflict(SQLiteDatabase.java:1471) at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase.insert(SQLiteDatabase.java:1341) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.ModelTable.add(ModelTable.java:44) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.ModelTable.add(ModelTable.java:69) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.database.writers.AwardListWriter.write(AwardListWriter.java:23) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.notifications.AwardsPostedNotification.updateDataLocally(AwardsPostedNotification.java:120) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.GCMMessageHandler.handleMessage(GCMMessageHandler.java:199) at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.gcm.GCMMessageHandler.onHandleIntent(GCMMessageHandler.java:127) at android.app.IntentService$ServiceHandler.handleMessage(IntentService.java:65) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:135) at android.os.HandlerThread.run(HandlerThread.java:61)
The script's JSON data differs from what the doc page says in that the "event_key": "2014necmp", property is at a different level of the data structure, but moving that field to match the doc causes com.google.gson.JsonParseException: Notification data does not contain 'event_key' It seems the code is failing to include a DB key in the SQL INSERT.

report.summary: Tap a summary notification -> "The Blue Alliance Debug has stopped"
report.label: None yet
report.description: Tapping a summary notification sometimes makes the app exit summarily. The OS displays a dialog "The Blue Alliance Debug has stopped" over the home screen. There's no acknowledgement of the crash in logcat (!) even with filters turned off but Android Studio's Run view displays a stack traceback. The stack has no TBA code but it does have third party library code io.nlopez.smartadapters. This occurs in the current master branch and also in the branch issue_774 where I'm testing a fix for #774. W/GAv4: Discarding hit. Missing tracking id parameter: a=1869011076,an=The Blue Alliance Debug,exd=NullPointerException (@DefaultBindableLayoutBuilder:viewType:38) {main},t=exception,sf=100.0,tid=,exf=1,aid=3.4.8-master.2+gd52ffe5,av=3.4.8-master.2+gd52ffe5 W/GAv4: syncDispatchLocalHits timed out: java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException E/AndroidRuntime: FATAL Steps to (sometimes) reproduce: Start an Android API level 21 or later emulator. Launch the app. Tap the Back button to return to the home screen. From a terminal window in the the-blue-alliance-android/ directory, run scripts/test_notification.py upcoming-match. This should open a heads-up notification shade. Wait for the notification shade to roll up. (This step might not be needed.) Run scripts/test_notification.py match-score. This should open another heads-up notification shade. Pull down the heads-up notification shade. This should reveal TBA's summary notification, "2 new notifications". Tap on the summary notification's content area.

report.summary: Android 7 group summary notifications aren't working
report.label: None yet
report.description: When a second or later notification arrives during MadTown ThrowDown this weekend, the notification shade chimes and re-displays the oldest notification that wasn't dismissed instead of accumulating a group summary notification. (I'll try to debug it when I get a chance.)

report.summary: NPE when a team has no name
report.label: None yet
report.description: The 9000 series teams at MadTown Throwdown today lack team names. This causes at least one crash: 11-10 23:17:24.816 6133 6133 E AndroidRuntime: Process: com.thebluealliance.androidclient, PID: 6133 11-10 23:17:24.816 6133 6133 E AndroidRuntime: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'boolean java.lang.String.isEmpty()' on a null object reference 11-10 23:17:24.816 6133 6133 E AndroidRuntime: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.listitems.StatsListElement.getView(StatsListElement.java:45) 11-10 23:17:24.816 6133 6133 E AndroidRuntime: at com.thebluealliance.androidclient.adapters.ListViewAdapter.getView(ListViewAdapter.java:29) 11-10 23:17:24.816 6133 6133 E AndroidRuntime: at android.widget.AbsListView.obtainView(AbsListView.java:2372) ... I'll send a PR.
